channel.title: [pi] can i put objects on a height level?
channel.description: title says it all, and where woudl i do this.

item.title: [pi] can i put objects on a height level?
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:11, topic:407062”]Make an if statement

if (c.getPA().heightLevel == 1) {
        c.getPA().object(o.objectId, o.objectX, o.objectY, o.face, o.type);
}

Probably not the correct declaration but that’s how it’s done.[/quote]
finally someone with some sense. thank you.

Read full topic
item.source: [pi] can i put objects on a height level?

item.title: [pi] can i put objects on a height level?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Make an if statement

if (c.getPA().heightLevel == 1) {
        c.getPA().object(o.objectId, o.objectX, o.objectY, o.face, o.type);
}

Probably not the correct declaration but that’s how it’s done.

item.title: [pi] can i put objects on a height level?
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

[quote=“mrdrzj, post:4, topic:407062”]find the object you want and find the coords, after the coords there shoudl be height level, 0-3
0=no height
1=1 floor up
2=2 floor up
3=3 floor up
etc…[/quote]
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(6552, 3097, 3506, 2, 10); //ancient prayers
i don’t think i can put height lvl in this

Read full topic
